action.action-desc: Ms. Perez introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to establish tax credits for personal locator beacons on certain vessels.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Bryson Fitch Fishermen Protection Act.

section.header: Business tax credit for locator beacons

subsection.text: Subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

For purposes of section 38, in the case of an eligible commercial fishing company, the personal locator beacon credit determined under this section for any taxable year is an amount equal to 50 percent of the sum of—

paragraph.text: the basis of any qualified beacon placed in service by the taxpayer during such taxable year, and
amounts paid by the taxpayer for the maintenance of any qualified beacon during such taxable year.

subparagraph.text: The term qualified beacon means a qualified emergency position-indicating radio beacon or qualified personal locator beacon which is placed in service on board a qualified vessel.
The term qualified emergency position-indicating radio beacon means a device installed on an eligible vessel that—

clause.text: transmits distress signals at a frequency between 406.0 and 406.1 MHz,
is manufactured by a company approved to manufacture beacons by the International Cospas-Sarsat Programme,
is registered with the United States National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, and
is acquired for use on commercial fishing vessels by the taxpayer who owns or operates an eligible vessel.

subparagraph.text: The term qualified personal locator beacon means a device designed to be carried by an individual that—

clause.text: transmits distress signals at a frequency between 406.0 and 406.1 MHz,
is manufactured by a company approved to manufacture beacons by the International Cospas-Sarsat Programme,
is registered with the United States National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, and
is acquired for use on commercial fishing vessels by the taxpayer who owns or operates an eligible vessel.

subparagraph.text: The term qualified vessel means an eligible vessel which is equipped with at least 1 qualified personal locator beacon for each individual on board such vessel.

paragraph.text: The term eligible commercial fishing company means a business which owns or operates in the course of business any eligible vessel.
The term eligible vessel means a vessel described in paragraph (12), (13), or (14) of section 2101 of title 46, United States Code.

subsection.text: This section shall not apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2028.

subsection.header: Credit To be part of general business credit
subsection.text: Section 38(b) of such Code is amended by striking plus at the end of paragraph (40), by striking the period at the end of paragraph (41) and inserting , plus, and by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: in the case of an eligible commercial fishing company (as defined in section 45BB), the locator beacon credit determined under section 45BB(a).

subsection.text: The table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new item:
The amendments made by this section shall apply to beacons placed in service in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2023.

section.header: Personal tax credit for purchase of certain personal locator beacons

subsection.text: Subpart A of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (relating to nonrefundable personal credits) is amended by inserting after section 25E the following new section:

section.header: Personal tax credit for purchase of certain personal locator beacons

subsection.text: In the case of an individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to 50 percent of the amounts paid or incurred by the taxpayer for the purchase of a qualified beacon during the taxable year.

paragraph.text: The term qualified beacon means a beacon—

subparagraph.text: described in subparagraph (B) or (C) of section 45BB(b)(1) (determined without regard to subparagraphs (B)(iv) or (C)(iv) thereof), and
which is purchased by the taxpayer for use on an eligible vessel which is not a qualified vessel.

paragraph.text: The terms eligible vessel and qualified vessel have the meaning given such terms in section 45BB(b)(1).

subsection.text: This section shall not apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2028.
The table of sections for subpart A of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of such Code is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 25E the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 25F. Personal tax credit for purchase of certain personal locator beacons.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2023.
